Hi Gordon Mohr,
Thanks for your suggestions . Looking at the=A0heritrix_ou=
t.log file, resolved the heritrxing starting problem. =A0I am in University=
 campus and I am able to crawl the intranet sites. To crawl other websites =
I need to do some proxy settings.=A0
Kindly let me know how to do the proxy=
 settings so that I can crawl other websites out of my intranet.=A0

FYI: M=
onkey-spider is a crawler based low-interaction client honeypot. Refer:=A0h=
ttp://monkeyspider.sourceforge.net/
Regards,
Sashidhar.=A0

--- On Mon, 4/4=
/11, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:

From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@arc=
hive.org>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem starting heritrix...... Pl=
z guide me
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Cc: "shashidhar" <shashidhar=
sden@...>
Date: Monday, 4 April, 2011, 10:06 PM

I hadn't heard of =
'Monkey-spider', it looks interesting.

This '......' indicates some proble=
m starting up, even before any 
proxies come into play. It can be because t=
he port it's seeking to use 
is already taken, or there are problems with t=
he Java version on the 
machine. So suggestions
 include:

(1) View any her=
itrix_out.log or heritrix_dmesg.log file that may be 
created; it may have =
additional info.

(2) Set the environment variable 'FOREGROUND' to 'true' b=
efore launching 
to see Heritrix output in the launch shell (rather than fo=
r it to just 
try reporting its startup before returning you to the shell p=
rompt).

(3) Make sure you're using the recommended version of Java: the 
S=
un/Oracle 1.6+ JDK.

(4) Make sure nothing else is running on the port conf=
igured to be the 
administrative interface (usually 8080).

Heritrix can cr=
awl through an HTTP proxy -- it requires extra 
configuration of the FetchH=
TTP processor -- but the failure to that 
would show up as a different, lat=
er problem than this.

- Gordon @ IA

On 4/4/11 12:52 AM, shashidhar wrote:=

> I am installing Monkey-spider... during the process of which I need to i=
nstall and run heritrix...
>
> I've
 downloaded heritrix-1.14.4 and followe=
d the steps for installation as described in http://crawler.archive.org/art=
icles/user_manual/install.html
>
> I did as described in section "Running H=
eritrix" in the above link.
>
> Now when I type :=A0=A0=A0% $HERITRIX_HOME/=
bin/heritrix --help
>
> I get
>
>> Mon Apr=A0 4 12:59:54 IST 2011 Starting =
heritrix .................... .............................................=
...........................................................................=
.................................................................
>
> just =
the dots are appearing continuously but heritrix isn't starting even after =
30-40min.
>
> I am working from University Campus: The campus has a Proxy s=
erver. Will that create any problem? Should I need to do any config
 settin=
gs/proxy settings in heritrix ?
>
> PS: I even tried installing it at home =
(with no proxy). But still the result is the same.
>
> As I tried installin=
g with proxy and without proxy,I don't understand what actually is the prob=
lem.
>
> Kindly let me know what's the problem and how to deal with it. I a=
m using Ubuntu 9.04. If you need any other details i'll let u know.
>
> Tha=
nks in Advance.
>
> -Sashidhar
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------=

>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>=A0 =A0 =A0 (Yahoo! ID required)
>
